EXTRACTED VALUE: Ultimately, Civilization Revolution gives back as much as you put into it. It’s a wholly satisfying experience whether you play alone or online.
Lost Odyssey is essential for fans, not due to the shortage of RPGs on Xbox 360, but based on its own qualities.
Perhaps the place where FIFA 08 shines the brightest is in what I am considering the revolutionary mode of online play.
It takes the GTA formula and condenses it into a game that requires a quarter of the time commitment.
Another great version of ice hockey for the Xbox 360. The amount on offer and a great online community will keep you on this game for ages.
This is, without a doubt, one of the best Star Wars games ever made, regardless of the age group.
Incredible controls, solid gameplay, beautiful graphics, and an engaging storyline.
Challenging and visceral, Lost Planet is one of those games that keeps you coming back, even when you're swearing up a storm after dying.
No matter how many first-person shooters the Xbox 360 has, there's always room for one of the quality of Unreal Tournament 3.
Capcom yet again proves that they are one of the few companies that knows how to resurrect a classic franchise.
A cocktail of equal parts exhilaration and terror, F.E.A.R. excels in every facet of game design. The definition of a must-play title.
The Skills Stick alone make NHL 07 a completely different game and one worthy of the new NHL. [Oct. 2006, p.96]
Part of what makes this game so fantastic is that it has the same joyful resonance as those mid-'90s NHL classics. The good times are back.
Without a doubt this is one of the top games for the Xbox 360 console and should definitely be included in every 360 owner's library.
Climax has taken an already near-perfect racer and polished it to a level of realism I didn’t expect this early in the 360 lifespan.
It’s nice to see a shooter with a fresh premise, which changes up the strategy you’ll use to get your best results.
